item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Lets get together to help animals who are in need. Please join the Dog-Hiking Meetup Team and walk with Breezy and I at this years MSPCA walk for animals.

A short walk, about 1.5 miles, that can do bunches to help the sick, neglected, and abused animals MSPCA cares for every day.

Want to join the team ... click yes on the RSVP and I'll send you all the links to our participation center.

Want to help Recruit ... Please add us to your social sites and invite all who love dogs to walk with us.

Want more Fun ... After the walk and entertainment lets think about a loop at the Fells or a patio that loves pups ... Your call Breezy and I would love to join you.

Want more information ... Take a look at my cut and paste, below, from the MSPCA Boston Walk Website

We hope to see you on the Boston Common ... and will be posting a meeting place as soon as MSPCA or, even better, someone from the group tells me where that should be.

Chat soon,

Kristan

Boston Schedule of Events
Sunday, September 13
Registration and Demonstrations: 11:00 a.m.
Walk begins: 12:00 p.m.
Activities and animal contests 1:00 p.m.
Fundraising and raffle awards 1:30 p.m.

Event Activities
There will be plenty of activities during the day to entertain both dogs and their two-footed friends.

On-site entertainment will include:

* Raffle, prizes, food and music
* Contests, Canine Agility Training, Live Entertainment
* MSPCA-Angell gift shop
* Cat table
* Kids’ Corner activities
* And more!

Registration
Registration and check-in is from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. If you have raised funds offline, please bring pledge sheets and cash or check donations to the registration table on the Boston Common. The Walk begins at Noon. Registration is $25 per person and includes a Walk for Animals event t-shirt distributed at the event.

Route
Our walk around the Common will be about 1.5 miles long.

Transportation
Get Driving Directions. If you are coming via public transportation, get off at the MBTA’s Park Street station and walk to the Boston Common. The event will take place at the Bandstand.

Dogs Welcome
We welcome all dogs that enjoy the company of other dogs. Please be sure your dog is leashed, licensed, in good physical condition and up to date on all vaccinations. Leashed dogs are welcome on T trains and buses at the discretion of each individual operator. Please leave cats and small animals safely and comfortably at home.

For more information:
Call: 617 522-WALK
Email: walkforanimals@mspca.org
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be the Brunette with Breezy, my white puff of a Bichon.
item.name: Walk For Pups
